# {{PROJECT_NAME}} Platform Documentation - LLM Navigation Index

> **START HERE**: For comprehensive LLM orchestration (plan files, concurrent execution, execution order, review loops), see [LLM.md](./LLM.md)

This file provides a quick navigation guide for LLMs working with the {{PROJECT_NAME}} platform documentation.

## Documentation Structure

```
docs/spec/
├── LLM.md                    # Master LLM orchestration guide (START HERE for complex tasks)
├── SPEC-WRITING-GUIDE.md     # How to write specification documents
├── README.md                 # Human-readable index
├── llms.txt                  # This file - quick navigation
├── .llm/                     # LLM coordination folder
│   ├── PROGRESS.md           # Accumulated knowledge and iteration log (READ BEFORE STARTING)
│   ├── plans/                # Active plan.llm files
│   ├── completed/            # Archived completed plans
│   └── templates/            # Plan templates (idea, fullstack, feature, bugfix, review, self-review)
├── framework/                # Generic patterns (read first)
└── biz/                      # Business specs (features, research, decisions)
```

## For Multi-Step Tasks

1. Read `LLM.md` first
2. Read `.llm/PROGRESS.md` for prior learnings
3. Create a plan file: `.llm/plans/{feature-name}.plan.llm`
4. Follow the execution order specified in `LLM.md`
5. Update your plan as you progress
6. Update `PROGRESS.md` with learnings when done

## Quick Document Selection

### Available Now (included in template)

| Topic | Load |
|-------|------|
| **Go code patterns** | `framework/go-generation-guide.md` (read first for any Go task) |
| **TypeScript/UI patterns** | `framework/typescript-ui-guide.md` (read first for any frontend task) |
| **Performance standards** | `framework/performance-guide.md` (read for performance-sensitive work) |
| **Writing new specs** | `SPEC-WRITING-GUIDE.md` (templates and depth expectations) |
| **Formatting nav sections** | `LLM-STYLE-GUIDE.md` |
| **LLM orchestration** | `LLM.md` (plan files, concurrent execution, review loops) |
| **Framework overview** | `framework/README.md` |
| **Business feature specs** | `biz/README.md` (feature specs, market research, decisions) |
| **Progress & learnings** | `.llm/PROGRESS.md` (accumulated knowledge, iteration log) |
| **Infrastructure** | `.llm/INFRASTRUCTURE.md` (Docker services, ports, health checks) |
| **MCP servers** | `.llm/MCP-RECOMMENDATIONS.md` (available servers and setup) |
| **System self-review** | `.llm/templates/self-review.plan.llm` (audit the LLM system itself) |

### Specs to Create (see SPEC-WRITING-GUIDE.md for templates)

<!-- As you create these specs, move them to the "Available Now" table above -->

| Topic | Suggested Spec |
|-------|---------------|
| REST API conventions | `framework/api-design.md` |
| Base model patterns | `framework/models.md` |
| Repository patterns | `framework/data-access.md` |
| Error handling | `framework/error-handling.md` |
| Route structure | `framework/routes.md` |
| Logging & metrics | `framework/observability.md` |

## Common Task Flows

### Review / Iteration Cycle
1. Read `.llm/PROGRESS.md` for codebase patterns
2. Pick highest-priority incomplete item from plan
3. Implement the change
4. Run quality gates (build, test, lint)
5. Update PROGRESS.md with learnings
6. Commit and move to next item

<!-- Uncomment and customize these as you create the referenced specs:

### Adding a new API endpoint
1. Load `framework/api-design.md` for REST conventions
2. Load `framework/models.md` for base model patterns
3. Load `framework/data-access.md` for repository patterns
4. Load `framework/routes.md` for route matrix

### Adding a new entity/model
1. Load `framework/models.md` for base patterns (ID, timestamps, soft delete)
2. Load `framework/api-design.md` for intent-specific types
3. Load `framework/data-access.md` for repository implementation

### Building a UI feature
1. Load `framework/typescript-ui-guide.md` for component patterns
2. Load `framework/performance-guide.md` for performance budgets
3. Load `framework/api-design.md` for API shapes
-->

## Document Categories

| Category | Purpose | Entry Point |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Framework** | Generic patterns | `framework/` |
| **Business** | Feature specs, research | `biz/` |
| **Coordination** | Plans, progress, templates | `.llm/` |

## Key Conventions

| Aspect | Convention | Example |
|--------|------------|---------|
| IDs | UUIDv7 (time-ordered) | `018f6b1a-0b3c-7d4e-8f9a-1b2c3d4e5f6a` |
| Timestamps | RFC 3339, UTC | `2024-01-15T10:30:00Z` |
| Updates | JSON Patch (RFC 6902) | `[{"op": "replace", "path": "/name", "value": "new"}]` |
| Pagination | Cursor-based | `?cursor=abc&limit=50` |
| Errors | E-codes | `{"code": "E3001", "message": "..."}` |
| API Versioning | URL path | `/api/v1/...` |
